data.text: @ofsevit A Harvard undergrad I talked to told me some people they know on sports teams were swabbing their armpits or something to avoid getting prevented from playing. UGH.
@ofsevit Still means cases are going up, which isn’t good
Update: Britain might not be nearly as bad as thought. https://t.co/mV2xgfTS30
@ofsevit Is there a twitter account just to watch Boston's 💩? Or a a website? Seems more accurate than testing at this point.
@RealMeMP In this chart cases are offset by 7 days compared to cases. (Other data is also shifted by more, see legend.) Here is the data without any shifts. https://t.co/iQ1FVoQxRS
@ofsevit Are we sure the poop data is a leading indicator? It always seems to tie pretty closely to cases over the same time periods.
@ofsevit Non-resident staff testing already ended a couple weeks ago, and unsurprisingly the numbers have been going up since then as fewer uninfected people get tested.
